result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

State requests bench warrant.

8:55 AM Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mark R Coleman in court.  Attorney Andrew Joseph Harrington in court for Mark R Coleman. 

8:57  Court relates and gives appearances.
8:57  Attorney Harrington indicates defendant wishes to waive right to preliminary hearing.
8:57  Court questions defendant; defendant indicates he wishes to waive right to preliminary hearing; Court accepts waiver.
8:58  Court finds probable cause; bound over.
Arraignment set; must appear in person.
Bond to continue.
Arraignment scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:04 AM Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mark R Coleman in court.  Attorney Andrew Joseph Harrington in court for Mark R Coleman.

Andrew Harrington to be repaid at the rate of $25.00/month to begin 7/29/22.

1:34 PM Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mark R Coleman in court, in person. Warrant is quashed. DE relates regarding non-appearance.  Bond is reinstated.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:18 AM Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mark R Coleman not in court.  State moves for bench warrant.  Court issues bench warrant, body only, Wisconsin and adjacent states.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473.

1:26 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mark R Coleman appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Andrew T Knaak appeared by video for Mark R Coleman. 

1:27  Court relates and gives appearances.  Court questions Mark.
Defendant must call the public defender's office to determine eligibility.  If the defendant does not qualify for public defender representation, the defendant must complete a Petition for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency also known as the blue form in order for the court to consider appointing an attorney. 
Court quashes warrant.
1:28 State relates.  
1:29 Mr. Coleman and Attorney Knaak go into break-out room; 1:30 return from break-out room.
